intro: Boerhavia, commonly known as redroot or blite, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Nyctaginaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink or red. The leaves are typically oval or lance-shaped and can be either simple or lobed, depending on the species. Many species are native to arid or semi-arid regions and are adapted to thrive in hot, dry climates. Some species are cultivated as ornamental plants or used in traditional medicine.
